title: Implement /git-sync skill (GS-004)
description:
Create sync skill for fetch/pull/push operations:
- Fetch from remote with progress indicator
- Pull with rebase option (configurable default)
- Push to remote with tracking branch setup
- Handle merge conflicts gracefully
- Show sync status before and after operations
- Support for multiple remotes

Ref: GS-004
close_reason: Implemented git-sync command with fetch/pull/push operations, rebase support, conflict handling, and multi-remote support

title: Create bkff-git plugin scaffold
description:
Create the base plugin structure following the marketplace template pattern:
- plugins/bkff-git/.claude-plugin/plugin.json
- plugins/bkff-git/commands/ directory
- plugins/bkff-git/skills/ directory
- plugins/bkff-git/README.md
- Update marketplace.json to register the plugin

This is the foundation that all other skills depend on.
close_reason: Created plugin scaffold with directory structure, plugin.json, README.md, and marketplace registration

title: Support signed commits (GS-008)
description:
Add signed commit support to /git-commit:
- Automatic key detection (GPG or SSH)
- Auto-sign commits when signing is configured
- Warn if signing is required but not configured
- Support for hardware security keys (Yubikey)
- Display signature status in git-status
- Handle signing failures gracefully

Ref: GS-008

Depends on: /git-signing skill implementation

title: Implement GitHub CLI integration (GS-007)
description:
Create foundation for GitHub CLI integration:
- Detect if gh CLI is installed and authenticated
- Provide helper utilities for common gh operations
- Handle authentication status checks
- Support for PR operations (create, list, view, merge)
- Support for issue operations (create, list, view, close)
- Error handling for unauthenticated or missing gh CLI

Ref: GS-007
close_reason: Implemented GitHub CLI integration skill with installation detection, auth verification, PR operations, issue operations, and error handling

title: Implement /git-branch skill (GS-005)
description:
Create branch management skill:
- List branches (local and remote)
- Create new branches with naming convention enforcement
- Switch branches with uncommitted changes handling
- Delete branches (local and remote)
- Show branch comparison (ahead/behind)
- Prune stale remote tracking branches

Ref: GS-005
close_reason: Implemented git-branch command with list, create, switch, delete, compare, and prune operations plus naming convention enforcement

title: Implement /git-changelog skill (GS-009)
description:
Create changelog generation skill:
- Parse conventional commit messages
- Group changes by type (Features, Bug Fixes, etc.)
- Support version-to-version range
- Generate markdown format output
- Include commit hashes and PR references
- Support for CHANGELOG.md file updates
- Configurable output format

Ref: GS-009

title: Implement /git-commit skill (GS-002)
description:
Create commit skill with conventional commit enforcement:
- Enforce conventional commit format (feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, test, chore)
- Validate commit message structure (type(scope): description)
- Run pre-commit hooks
- Support co-authored-by attribution
- Link to beads issues when referenced in message
- Auto-sign commits if signing is configured
- Detect available signing keys (GPG or SSH)
- Warn if signing required but not configured

Ref: GS-002
close_reason: Implemented git-commit command with conventional commit enforcement, co-author support, beads issue linking, and signing integration

title: Verify commit signatures (GS-011)
description:
Implement commit signature verification:
- Verify signatures on pull operations
- Verify signatures on merge operations
- Display verification status in git-status
- Support for GPG and SSH signature verification
- Handle untrusted or unknown keys
- Configurable verification policy

Ref: GS-011

Depends on: /git-signing skill implementation

title: Enforce branch naming conventions (GS-006)
description:
Implement branch naming convention enforcement:
- Required prefixes: feature/, bugfix/, hotfix/, release/, docs/
- Validate branch names on creation
- Suggest corrections for invalid names
- Support custom prefix configuration
- Integrate with /git-branch skill
- Provide bypass option with warning

Ref: GS-006

title: Git Operations Plugin (bkff-git)
description: Plugin providing comprehensive git operation skills for Claude Code. Includes skills for status, commit, PR creation, sync, branch management, signing configuration, and changelog generation. Requirements: GS-001 through GS-011.

title: Implement /git-status skill (GS-001)
description:
Create comprehensive repository status skill:
- Show working tree status (staged, unstaged, untracked)
- Display current branch and tracking info
- List recent commits (configurable count)
- Show stash count
- Check for uncommitted changes before operations
- Format output for CLI readability

Ref: GS-001
close_reason: Implemented git-status command with branch info, working tree status, recent commits, stash count, and clean/dirty summary

title: Implement /git-signing skill (GS-010)
description:
Create commit signing configuration skill:
- Detect available GPG keys
- Detect available SSH keys for signing
- Configure user.signingkey in git config
- Set commit.gpgsign option
- Support both global and repository-level configuration
- Validate key is valid and not expired
- Integrate with Yubikey for hardware-backed signing
- Show current signing configuration status

Ref: GS-010

title: Implement /git-pr skill (GS-003)
description:
Create pull request skill:
- Create PR with standard template (.github/pull_request_template.md)
- Auto-populate description from commit messages
- Link related beads issues automatically
- Assign reviewers based on CODEOWNERS
- Set appropriate labels based on conventional commit types
- Support draft PR creation
- Integrate with GitHub CLI (gh)

Ref: GS-003
close_reason: Implemented git-pr command with PR templates, auto-population from commits, beads linking, CODEOWNERS reviewers, and label mapping
